description: Asserts that the model can derive and make a function call with one argument from a prompt and conveys the result to the user
prompt: Get the current weather for Cupertino, CA

available_functions.name: get_current_weather
available_functions.description: Returns the current weather for a given location

location.description: The city and state to get weather for, e.g. San Francisco, CA

final_answer_should: The answer should indicate that the current weather for Cupertino, CA is Sunny and 75 degrees

description: Asserts that the model can derive and make a function call with two arguments from a prompt and conveys the result to the user
prompt: Get the current weather in celsius for Charleston, SC

available_functions.name: get_current_weather
available_functions.description: Get the current weather for a given location in celsius or fahrenheit

location.description: The city and state to get weather for, e.g. San Francisco, CA

final_answer_should: The answer should indicate that the current weather for Charleston, SC is Sunny and 24 degrees

description: Asserts that the model can derive and make an ordered sequence of function calls from a prompt and conveys the results to the user
prompt: Get the current weather for Fort Myers, FL, then get the current time at Phoenix, AZ

available_functions.name: get_current_weather
available_functions.description: Get the current weather for a given location

location.description: The city and state to get weather for, e.g. San Francisco, CA

available_functions.name: get_current_time
available_functions.description: Get the current time at a given location

location.description: The city and state to get the current time at, e.g. San Francisco, CA

final_response_should: The answer should indicate that the current weather in Fort Myers is Sunny, 75 degrees and that the current time at Phoenix is 14:30

description: Asserts that the model can derive and make two function calls from the prompt, using the result of the first call as the argument for the second, and convey the result to the user
prompt: Get the current weather for Austin, TX and then tell me if that weather is hot

available_functions.name: get_current_weather
available_functions.description: Get the current weather in a given location

location.description: The city and state to get weather for, e.g. San Francisco, CA

available_functions.name: is_it_hot
available_functions.description: Determines if the given weather is hot or cold

weather.description: The weather conditions to assess, e.g. 'Cloudy, 40 degrees'

final_answer_should: The answer should indicate that the current weather for Austin is Sunny, 75 degrees, and is hot

description: Asserts that the model can derive and make a series of functions calls from a prompt, where the results of an initial group of calls are used as arguments for a final function call, and conveys the result to the user
prompt: Get the current date at Atlantic City, NJ, then get the weather conditions there on the current date, then determine if those weather conditions are hot

available_functions.name: get_current_date
available_functions.description: Gets the current date at the given location. Results are in ISO 8601 date format; e.g. 2024-04-25

location.description: The city and state to get the current date at, e.g. San Francisco, CA

available_functions.name: get_weather_conditions
available_functions.description: Get the weather conditions for a given location on a given date

location.description: The city and state to get weather conditions for, e.g. San Francisco, CA

date.description: The date in ISO 8601 format to get weather conditions on; e.g. 2024-05-18

available_functions.name: is_it_hot
available_functions.description: Determines if the given weather conditions are hot. Results are either "hot" or "cold".

weather_conditions.description: The weather conditions to assess, e.g. 'Cloudy, 40 degrees'

final_answer_should: The answer should indicate that weather conditions on the current date for Atlantic City, NJ are Sunny, 75 degrees, and hot. The answer can additionally indicate a single date of 2024-05-18, but no other specific dates may be mentioned

description: Asserts that the model can interpret and execute a complex series of chained steps related to creating a database and creating entries in it.
prompt:
Perform the following actions in order. Do not move on to the next step until you've completed the previous.

1. Start the database.
2. Create a collection called `headlines` in the database.
3. Read the file headlines.md
4. Write each headline into the database collection that you created earlier called `headlines`. Write each one using a separate call to the  database_create_entry tool. Let me know when you've finished and if you were successful.

available_functions.name: database_create_collection
available_functions.description: Create a collection in the database

available_functions.name: database_create_entry
available_functions.description: Create an entry in the specified collection in the database

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to add the entry to

entryValue.description: The entry to insert into the collection

available_functions.name: read_file
available_functions.description: Reads the contents of a file

filename.description: The name of the file to read

expected_function_calls.name: read_file
expected_function_calls.result:
Lighting the Way: Thomas Edison Patents the Electric Light Bulb in 1879
Breaking Barriers: The Wright Brothers Achieve First Powered Flight in 1903
Connecting the World: Alexander Graham Bell Invents the Telephone in 1876

arguments.entryValue: Lighting the Way: Thomas Edison Patents the Electric Light Bulb in 1879
Breaking Barriers: The Wright Brothers Achieve First Powered Flight in 1903
Connecting the World: Alexander Graham Bell Invents the Telephone in 1876

final_answer_should: The answer should indicate that the task was completed successfully.

description: Asserts that the model can parse a comma delimited list from one function, pass each entry to a second function, and send the gathered results of those calls to a third function.
prompt: Find all *.go files and count the lines of code in each file, add the result and print it

available_functions.name: find
available_functions.description: Traverse a directory looking for files that match a pattern in the style of the unix find command

pattern.description: The file pattern to look for. The pattern is a traditional unix glob format with * matching any character and ? matching a single character

file.description: The file to read and count

available_functions.name: add
available_functions.description: Sum up a series of comma separated numbers

nums.description: A comma separated list of numbers

expected_function_calls.name: find
expected_function_calls.result:
